meanings.definition: An area of rolling hills or open country
meanings.sent1: The cows grazed peacefully in the downlands.
meanings.sent2: The farmers enjoyed the vast expanse of downlands for their crops.
meanings.sent3: The downlands seemed to whisper secrets to the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast downlands of thoughts, rolling and endless.
meanings.sent5: The downlands stretched out like a green blanket under the sky.

meanings.definition: The lower or downhill side of a slope or hill
meanings.sent1: The hikers carefully descended the downlands to reach the valley below.
meanings.sent2: The children rolled down the downlands, laughing all the way.
meanings.sent3: The downlands were feeling a bit down today, being the lower side of the hill.
meanings.sent4: His spirits sank like the downlands as he reached the bottom of the slope.
meanings.sent5: The downlands sloped gently, inviting all to explore their mysteries.
